Data Structures

class  Tab

Detailed Description

A TabControl allows to embed controls inside a variable number of tab pages. The navigation between the tab pages is done by the left and right arrow key. A tab page is represented by a text, an icon and a control which acts as page content.

Inserts a tab page.

Parameters:
index Index, where the tab page should be inserted. When -1 is used, the tab page will be added to the end of all available tab pages.

Is invoked whenever the active tab page has been changed.

void TabControl::RemoveTab (  INT  index  ) 
 

Removes the tab page with the given index.

void TabControl::SetActiveTab (  INT  index  ) 
 

Sets the currently active tab page by specifying its index. Also disabled tabs can be set to active, although the default navigation with the left and right arrow key won't activate a disabled tab.

void TabControl::SetHeaderEnabled (  BOOLEAN  enabled  ) 
 

Enables the header for tabs, if enabled is TRUE (per default the header for tabs is disabled). If the header is enabled, a line below the tabs contains the text of the currently active tab and the tab itself only contains the icon. Enabling the header is useful if the tabs contain long texts which don't fit into the available width.

BOOLEAN TabControl::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented from Control.

void TabControl::SetTabEnabled (  INT  index,
BOOLEAN  enabled
) 
 

Enables the tab page specified by its index. Per default all tab pages are enabled. A disabled tab page may get activated, but no focus is given to the content of the tab page.
